name: ESSAI 2026
venue: European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence, Vienna, Austria
description: The 4th European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence (ESSAI) will take place in Vienna, Austria, from 6 to 10 July 2026. It offers a one‑week intensive program of introductory and advanced AI courses, tutorials, and social activities aimed at PhD students, young researchers, and senior scholars. Participants can attend parallel tracks covering all AI sub‑disciplines, network with international experts, and enjoy a rich social program including a reception at the Vienna City Hall.

name: OpenEuroLLM Winter School
venue: Skeikampen Conference Hotel, near Oslo, Norway
description: The 2026 Winter School on Multilinguality in LLM Development and Evaluation is organized by the Nordic Language Processing Laboratory and the OpenEuroLLM project at a conference hotel near Oslo, Norway. It targets NLP researchers, especially those from EuroHPC consortium countries, and doctoral students, offering technical presentations, hands‑on elements, and discussions on multilingual large language models and their evaluation. The program includes expert talks, a bus transfer from Oslo airport, and is subsidized with no participation fee, providing meals and accommodation at the Skeikampen hotel.

name: Probabilistic AI School
description: ProbAI School 2026 is a Probabilistic AI summer school taking place in Vilnius, Lithuania. It aims to provide an inclusive educational environment covering state‑of‑the‑art machine learning and artificial intelligence topics. The programme welcomes enthusiasts, students, academics, and industry professionals to participate.

name: BMVA Computer Vision Summer School
description: The 29th BMVA Computer Vision Summer School will be held at Durham University in Durham, England, UK. It offers an intensive week of lectures and lab sessions covering a wide range of topics in computer vision, delivered by researchers from leading UK and international groups. The programme features daily oral talks and hands‑on sessions designed to provide participants with deep, practical knowledge of current computer‑vision methods.

name: Oxford Machine Learning Summer School 2026
venue: Oxford ML School, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: OxML Summer 2026 offers participants the chance to upskill in the latest AI theory and applications through three specialised tracks, with instruction from world‑renowned experts from frontier AI labs in academia and industry. The programme is hosted by the Oxford ML School and can be attended in Oxford or online, allowing a customisable learning experience. Prospective attendees are invited to register early to be notified when applications open.

name: Robotics, Perception and Learning (RPL) Summer School
venue: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden
description: The RPL Summer School 2026 is a six‑day event organized by the Department for Robotics, Perception and Learning at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden. It brings together doctoral and postdoctoral researchers to discuss topics such as machine learning, computer vision, robotics, human‑robot interaction, planning and decision making through keynotes, industry talks, brainstorming sessions and student presentations. The program is hosted at the Happy Tammsvik resort, offering participants accommodation, meals and various indoor and outdoor activities to foster collaboration and generate concrete research ideas.

name: Machine Learning Crash Course at MALGA
description: The MLCC2026 Summer School, titled Machine Learning Crash Course, is a five‑day intensive program held at the University of Genoa in Genoa, Italy. It provides an introduction to fundamental machine‑learning concepts and algorithms, combining theoretical lectures with hands‑on lab sessions for undergraduate, graduate students and professionals. The course is in‑person only, includes daily lunches, and offers university credit upon successful completion and a final test.

name: UK Robotics Summer School
venue: National Robotarium, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
description: The UK Robotics Summer School 2026 is a five‑day program held at the National Robotarium, Heriot‑Watt University in Edinburgh. It offers expert‑led lectures, tutorials, and industry talks on cutting‑edge topics such as bio‑inspired robotics, healthcare robotics, generative AI for robotics, and safe AI verification. Targeted at master’s‑level students and industry practitioners, the school combines theoretical sessions with hands‑on experience and networking opportunities.

name: International Summer School for Advanced Studies on Biometrics, Behavior, and Vision
description: The 2026 Biometrics Summer School takes place in Alghero, Sardinia, Italy, hosted at the Hotel Dei Pini. It focuses on the impact of generative AI and large foundation models on biometric and human recognition technologies, covering machine learning, image understanding, signal analysis, neuroscience, robotics, and forensic science. The program is aimed at PhD students, post‑docs, researchers, forensic examiners and professionals, offering intensive lectures, keynote talks, and hands‑on sessions for about 70 pre‑selected participants, with scholarships and optional videoconference attendance.

name: 1st Internationa School on the Cognitive, Ethical, and Societal Dimensions of AI - AIces
description: AIces 2026 is the first international school focusing on the cognitive, ethical and societal dimensions of artificial intelligence. It targets graduate students, postgraduate researchers and industry practitioners, offering parallel courses, symposia and open debates that can be attended in person in Porto–Maia or online. The event emphasizes multidisciplinary discussions, hands‑on networking, and provides recorded lectures for 45 days after the school.

name: Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal (ELS) aspects of AI and AS at Umeå University
description: The Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal aspects of AI and Autonomous Systems brings together researchers and students to explore the interdisciplinary challenges of emerging technologies. It offers a program of lectures, hands‑on multidisciplinary training, a poster session, and a social program to foster networking and professional exchange. The event takes place at Umeå University in Sweden from 11 to 13 March 2026.

name: Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM 2026)
description: The Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM'26) will be held at the Escandille in Autrans, France, from 9 to 13 February 2026. The school aims to bring together researchers from fields such as computer vision, speech/audio processing, and human‑robot interaction to foster cross‑disciplinary exchange through courses, talks, and hands‑on sessions. Set in the scenic Vercors mountains near Grenoble, the event also offers informal networking and outdoor activities in a relaxed atmosphere.

name: Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) Melbourne
description: The 2026 Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) takes place in Melbourne, Australia at the Sandridge Events Centre. It targets 50 hand‑picked PhD students and early‑career researchers, offering two weeks of lectures and tutorials covering core theory and emerging topics beyond large language models. World‑class speakers from academia and industry present on subjects such as deep learning, generative modeling, reinforcement learning and AI in industry, with stipends available for selected participants.

name: Northern Lights Deep Learning Winter School
venue: UiT The Arctic University of Norway, Tromsø, Norway
description: The Winter School is part of the Northern Lights Deep Learning Conference 2027 and will be held in Tromsø, Norway. It focuses on deep learning techniques, covering topics such as image classification, object detection, segmentation, time‑series prediction, and speech recognition. The school targets researchers and practitioners, offering opportunities to exchange ideas, foster collaborations, and learn about cutting‑edge research.

name: Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS)
description: The Sixth Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS) is an 11‑day intensive program held at Swostishree Gurukul in Sanobharyang, Kathmandu, Nepal. It offers a comprehensive curriculum covering AI fundamentals, advanced methods, and hands‑on labs and project work for senior undergraduates, graduate students, PhD candidates, faculty, and industry professionals. The school aims to foster collaboration, provide state‑of‑the‑art AI knowledge, and inspire participants from Nepal and the region to tackle high‑impact AI challenges.

name: EEML Summer School
description: The Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School takes place in Cetinje, Montenegro, hosted by the University of Montenegro. It offers a week of lectures and tutorials on cutting‑edge machine learning topics, delivered by leading researchers from academia and industry. The program is aimed at graduate students and early‑career researchers from the region who want to deepen their knowledge and expand their professional network.

name: Mediterranean Summer School
venue: University of Split Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture, Split, Croatia
description: The Mediterranean Machine Learning (M2L) Summer School is a five‑day program held at the University of Split’s Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture in Split, Croatia. It features keynotes, lectures and hands‑on sessions covering topics such as computer vision, natural language processing, generative models and reinforcement learning, and offers optional poster presentations and networking activities. The school targets doctoral and outstanding master students, as well as academics and practitioners worldwide, with an emphasis on promoting diversity and collaboration in the Mediterranean machine‑learning community.

name: Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI
venue: Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications, Rabat, Morocco
description: The 2nd edition of the AI Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI is a five‑day immersive program jointly organized by MoroccoAI, INPT, IMT Nord Europe, and Soft Centre in Rabat, Morocco. It targets young researchers, Ph.D. students, post‑docs, senior researchers, and professionals, offering expert lectures, hands‑on labs, and project work to build practical AI skills and leadership. Participants will benefit from direct interaction with leading AI scientists, networking opportunities, and a partnership aimed at developing the next generation of AI leaders in Morocco.

name: AthNLP Summer School 2026
description: The Athens Natural Language Processing Summer School 2026 will be held at the NCSR Demokritos campus in Athens, Greece. The program, organized jointly by RC “Athena”, NCSR “Demokritos”, Athens University of Economics and Business (Department of Informatics) and Heriot‑Watt University, focuses on advanced topics in natural language processing. It runs from 2 September to 8 September 2026 and aims to bring together researchers and students for intensive lectures and workshops.

name: Advanced Artificial Intelligence: GenAI & Deep Unsupervised Learning
venue: Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: The Advanced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning summer school at Lady Margaret Hall focuses on generative AI and deep unsupervised learning techniques. It offers theoretical foundations and hands‑on experience with clustering, GANs, self‑supervised learning, and other state‑of‑the‑art models across various real‑world domains. The programme is aimed at STEM students with intermediate AI/ML knowledge who are considering graduate study or research.

name: AI4Science Summer School
description: The 2nd Summer School on Advancing Scientific Discovery with AI brings together PhD students, post‑doctoral researchers and scientists to explore how artificial intelligence can accelerate scientific research. The program covers machine learning for data analysis, AI‑driven experimental design, generative models, and integration of AI with physical simulations, and includes hands‑on workshops using Python libraries such as NumPy and PyTorch. Emphasizing deep learning rather than large language models, the school aims to equip participants with practical skills for applying AI to their own scientific projects.

name: LUT Summer School
description: LUT Summer School is a one‑week intensive programme offering courses on sustainability, climate action, marketing, management and the intersection of business and technology. It is aimed at bachelor’s and master’s students from any university who wish to earn 3 ECTS credits while experiencing Finnish summer on the Lappeenranta campus. The programme combines lectures, workshops and group work with a social programme that includes sauna evenings and outdoor activities in the Finnish nature.

name: Armenian LLM Summer School 2025
description: The LLM Summer School 2026 is an intensive program for students and researchers focusing on the latest advancements in Large Language Models. It will be held in Yerevan, Armenia and will feature a combination of lectures, hands‑on workshops, and a hackathon where participants can apply their knowledge to innovative projects. The event is part of an annual series that aims to provide comprehensive training and networking opportunities in the field of LLMs.
